snippet: A mother reflects on the lack of charges brought in the police killings in Ferguson, Mo., and on Staten Island, a subject that weighs on many black parents who fear for their children’s safety.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column reflects on lack of charges brought in police killings in Ferguson, Mo, and on Staten Island, subject that weighs on many black parents who fear for their children's safety; acknowledges that Michael Brown and Eric Garner were breaking the law when they encountered the police, but that is not always the case.
lead_paragraph: A mother reflects on the lack of charges brought in the police killings in Ferguson, Mo., and on Staten Island, a subject that weighs on many black parents who fear for their children’s safety.

headline.main: Shielding Children From Talk of Ferguson and Garner
headline.print_headline: A Conversation About the Police a Mother Didn’t Want to Have
